📒 Files selected for processing (1) * `swarms-web/tests/e2e/sessions.spec.ts` (1 hunks)
🧰 Additional context used
🧬 Code graph analysis (1)
swarms-web/tests/e2e/sessions.spec.ts (1)
spds/session_store.py (1) * `SessionMeta` (19-25)
🔇 Additional comments (6)
swarms-web/tests/e2e/sessions.spec.ts (6)
`201-213`: **Nice: deterministic IDs eliminate flakiness** Incrementing counter-based IDs make assertions stable and debuggable. --- `271-285`: **Good coverage for the list limit param** Directly exercising the mocked API with limit=1 locks the server behavior. --- `337-357`: **Robust chat navigation matching** Using '**/chat*' for both routing and waitForURL avoids query-string mismatches. --- `359-393`: **Good replacement of sleeps with URL assertions** Negative URL checks make tests resilient and faster. --- `158-163`: **AlpineJS stub looks good (previous nit addressed)** Stub prevents ReferenceError while keeping script load behavior. --- `167-170`: **HEAD/OPTIONS handling added for /api/sessions (previous feedback addressed)** Prevents accidental fall-through to network.

relevant_comments.author: coderabbitai
relevant_comments.body:
## Walkthrough Adds a new Playwright end-to-end test suite for session management that mocks /api/sessions (GET/POST/resume), provides helpers for JSON handling and toast assertions, sets up test-time global shims, and exercises list/create/resume and error/validation scenarios. ## Changes | Cohort / File(s) | Summary of changes | | --- | --- | | **E2E session management tests**
`swarms-web/tests/e2e/sessions.spec.ts` | New Playwright E2E suite adding: TypeScript types (`SessionMeta`, `JsonResponse`), `baseSessions` test data, helper utilities (`fulfillJson`, `parseJson`, `expectToast`), test lifecycle state (in-memory sessions, overrides, request logs), bootstrap/global shims, route interceptions for socket/bootstrap/alpine assets, mocked `/api/sessions` endpoints (GET with limit/override, POST create with derived fields and in-memory update, resume validation with 400/404/200), and comprehensive test cases for listing, limits, empty/error states, create flow and validation, resume flow and error handling, and refreshing after deletions. | ## Sequence Diagram(s) ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Page as Browser Page (Playwright) participant Mock as In-memory Mock Server (route handlers) participant Sessions as In-memory Sessions List rect rgb(233,245,255) Note over Page,Mock: Test setup installs route handlers & shims end Page->>Mock: GET /api/sessions?limit=N Mock->>Sessions: read (apply limit / overrides) Sessions-->>Mock: return session list Mock-->>Page: 200 JSON sessions Page->>Mock: POST /api/sessions (create payload) Mock->>Mock: validate payload alt valid Mock->>Sessions: append new session (derive id/title/ts) Sessions-->>Mock: created session Mock-->>Page: 201 JSON created else invalid Mock-->>Page: 400/422 error end Page->>Mock: POST /api/sessions/resume (id) Mock->>Sessions: lookup id alt found Mock-->>Page: 200 JSON (resume success) else not found Mock-->>Page: 404 end ``` ## Estimated code review effort 🎯 3 (Moderate) | ⏱️ ~25 minutes ## Possibly related PRs - mruderman/subjective-priority-driven-swarm#12 — Adds Playwright E2E setup/config and dev-dependencies that this new sessions.spec.ts relies on. ## Poem > I hop through routes with whiskers keen, > Mocking storms behind the screen. > Sessions sprout where test lights beam, > Toasts that sparkle, data streams. > With tiny paws I run the play, > Green carrots greet the QA day. 🐇🌿 ## Pre-merge checks and finishing touches
✅ Passed checks (3 passed) | Check name | Status | Explanation | | :----------------: | :------- | :--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Description Check | ✅ Passed | Check skipped - CodeRabbit’s high-level summary is enabled. | | Title Check | ✅ Passed | The title succinctly and accurately reflects the changeset: new Playwright tests adding coverage for session lifecycle flows (listing, creation, resume, refresh) and related error scenarios. It is concise, specific, and aligned with the PR objectives and file-level changes. | | Docstring Coverage | ✅ Passed | No functions found in the changes. Docstring coverage check skipped. |
✨ Finishing touches - [ ] 📝 Generate Docstrings
🧪 Generate unit tests - [ ] Create PR with unit tests - [ ] Post copyable unit tests in a comment - [ ] Commit unit tests in branch `codex/expand-browser-tests-for-session-lifecycle`
--- Thanks for using CodeRabbit! It's free for OSS, and your support helps us grow. If you like it, consider giving us a shout-out.
❤️ Share - [X](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=I%20just%20used%20%40coderabbitai%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20the%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A&url=https%3A//coderabbit.ai) - [Mastodon](https://mastodon.social/share?text=I%20just%20used%20%40coderabbitai%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20the%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fcoderabbit.ai) - [Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/submit?title=Great%20tool%20for%20code%20review%20-%20CodeRabbit&text=I%20just%20used%20CodeRabbit%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A%20https%3A//coderabbit.ai) - [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/sharing/share-offsite/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcoderabbit.ai&mini=true&title=Great%20tool%20for%20code%20review%20-%20CodeRabbit&summary=I%20just%20used%20CodeRabbit%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20proprietary%20code)

relevant_comments.author: chatgpt-codex-connector
relevant_comments.body:
Codex Review: Didn't find any major issues. What shall we delve into next?

<details> <summary>About Codex in GitHub</summary>

[Your team has set up Codex to review pull requests in this repo](http://chatgpt.com/codex/settings/general). Reviews are triggered when you open a pull request for review, mark a draft as ready, or comment "@codex review". If Codex has suggestions, it will comment; otherwise it will react with 👍.

Codex can also answer questions or update the PR. Try commenting "@codex fix this CI failure" or "@codex address that feedback".
</details>

relevant_comments.author: chatgpt-codex-connector
relevant_comments.body:
**Summary**
* Hardened the Playwright mocks by parsing request bodies via `postDataJSON`, fulfilling HEAD/OPTIONS, generating deterministic session IDs, and matching `/api/sessions*` requests so query strings stay stubbed. [swarms-web/tests/e2e/sessions.spec.tsL40-L218](https://github.com/mruderman/subjective-priority-driven-swarm/blob/945151e947be4b29c0cd772cab925084107c762c/swarms-web/tests/e2e/sessions.spec.ts#L40-L218)
* Added coverage for the `limit` query parameter, switched table assertions to stable locators, matched `/chat*` routes, and replaced fixed waits with URL expectations to keep resume flows reliable. [swarms-web/tests/e2e/sessions.spec.tsL271-L395](https://github.com/mruderman/subjective-priority-driven-swarm/blob/945151e947be4b29c0cd772cab925084107c762c/swarms-web/tests/e2e/sessions.spec.ts#L271-L395)

**Testing**
* ✅ `npx playwright test tests/e2e/sessions.spec.ts`

 [View task →](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_68d31a23dd7483329db9d752a6b025fd)
